Not a bad idea. You wouldn't have to worry about the headache that is browser support. I don't think many users will trust an arbitrary piece of code running on their computer, though.
np

ZeroNet probably needs its own browser, within which, no iframe is necessary. A lot of what the iframe does is to reduce the permissions of zites and to provide an interface to the zeronet daemon, which are most likely achievable within a browser.
It wouldn't outright replace the iframe system, but would provide an easier and more secure way to install zeronet.
But the fact the the browser that ZeroHello recommends you use breaks many sites is a problem.
Tor browser doesn't outright break a lot of sites, but it renders a lot of icons as text, making the ui of many sites an eyesore.
![alt text](data/users/1N6MvANNCvPkZ4ovSGDpKt7EVqdNF4tkev/nbmao5xcwmhoozu610s20rwgxjmt2yqf.png) For example, here is ZeroLSTN.bit in tor broswer.
I might switch to icecat with invalid proxy settings for zeronet.
Zeronetia/Zeronetica is looking good though. I haven
*I havan't seen any other players on it though, should I be able to?
It works fine.

I'll try it out.
